name: Water
description: The amount of fresh water in the world is only about 2 percent

name: Sulfuric acid
description: Sulfuric acid is used in car batteries

name: Nitric acid
description: Nitric acid is one of the strongest acids

name: Nitrous acid
description: The diluted nitrous acid solution has a bluish tint

name: Sulfurous acid
description: Sulphurous acid is unstable. In air, it breaks down into water and sulfur dioxide

name: Hydrogen
description: Hydrogen is 14.5 times lighter than air. This is the lightest gas

name: Chlorine
description: Chlorine is a greenish yellow poisonous gas

name: Bromine
description: Bromine is the only non-metal that is liquid at room temperature

name: Hydrogen chloride
description: The concentration of hydrochloric acid in the human stomach is 0.3-0.5%

name: Hydrogen bromide
description: Hydrogen bromide is thermally very stable; at a temperature of 1832°F, about 0.5% of the molecules decompose

name: Sodium hydroxide (caustic soda)
description: Sodium hydroxide is used in the manufacture of soaps

name: Potassium hydroxide (caustic potash)
description: When working with potassium hydroxide, use protection to prevent chemical burns

name: Lithium hydroxide
description: Lithium hydroxide was used as a carbon dioxide absorber in gas masks

name: Barium hydroxide
description: Barium hydroxide is toxic, the threshold limit value is 0.5 mg / m³

name: Sulfur
description: Sulfur gas is a gas with a characteristic pungent odor of an igniting match

name: Sulfur trioxide
description: Sulfur trioxide is used in the production of sulfuric acid

name: Nitric oxide
description: Nitric oxide helps maintain vascular homeostasis, causing relaxation of the smooth muscles of the vessel walls

name: Nitrogen dioxide
description: Nitrogen dioxide is a poisonous gas of red-brown color

name: Dinitrogen pentoxide
description: Dinitrogen pentoxide oxide interacts with organic substances and polymers, so it is stored in a glass container

name: Lithium oxide
description: The melting point of lithium oxide is 2858°F

name: Sodium oxide
description: Sodium oxide is best stored in anhydrous benzene

name: Potassium permanganate
description: Diluted potassium permanganate solution is used as an antiseptic

name: Manganese (VII) oxide
description: Manganese (VII) oxide decomposes with an explosion above 131°F

name: Sodium chloride
description: Sodium chloride is a common salt that everyone has in the kitchen

name: Potassium sulfate
description: Potassium sulfate is a valuable non-chlorine fertilizer

name: Aluminium sulfate
description: Aluminum sulfate is used in water treatment

name: Potassium dichromate
description: Potassium dichromate is used in black and white photography as a bleach to remove metallic silver from an emulsion

name: Calcium carbonate
description: Calcium carbonate is the basis of chalk

name: Carbon dioxide
description: Carbon monoxide absorbs infrared radiation emitted by the Earth

name: Carbon monoxide
description: Carbon monoxide (II) is the second most abundant (after hydrogen) molecule in the interstellar medium

name: Sodium nitrate
description: Sodium nitrate is used as a fertilizer

name: Oxygen
description: Solid oxygen is a light blue crystal

name: Dinitrogen
description: Liquid nitrogen is used as a refrigerant

name: Magnesium chloride
description: Magnesium chloride is used to produce magnesia cements

name: Trisodium phosphate
description: Sodium phosphate is used to bleach glass when melted

name: Tripotassium phosphate
description: Potassium phosphate is used as a component of liquid detergents

name: Phosphoric acid
description: Phosphoric acid is used to clean metal surfaces from rust

name: Sodium amide
description: Sodium amide is used in organic synthesis

name: Ozone
description: Ozone is used to sterilize medical devices

name: Sodium peroxide
description: When working with sodium peroxide, use respirators, goggles and protective clothing

name: Chromium (III) hydroxide
description: Chromium(III) hydroxide is a substance of gray-green color
